text: Dame Louise Agnetha Lake-Tack, GCMG, DStJ (born 26 July 1944) is a former Governor-General of Antigua and Barbuda. ==Background and earlier career== Louise Lake-Tack was born in St. Philip's Parish, Antigua in 1944. She went to Freetown Government School before attending the Antigua Girls High School in St. John's.Antigua Gets First Female Governor General Hard Beat News.com 16 July 2007 After graduating she went to the United Kingdom. She studied nursing at Charing Cross Hospital. She worked first at the National Heart Hospital and later at the Harley Street Clinic. Lake-Tack later studied and graduated in law. She was a magistrate at both Marylebone and Horseferry Magistrate Courts. She also sat at Pocock Street Crown Court and Middlesex Crown Court to hear appeal cases from the lower courts. She was a member of the Antigua and Barbuda National Association (London) for the 24 years before her appointment as Governor-General. ==Governor-General== She took office as Governor-General of Antigua and Barbuda on 17 July 2007.Antigua's first female G-G sworn in Jamaica Gleaner July 19, 2007 She was the first woman to hold the office. On 14 August 2014, she was replaced by Dr Rodney Williams, who took office as the 4th Governor General of Antigua and Barbuda. ==Honours== *Dame Grand Cross of the Most Distinguished Order of Saint Michael and Saint George (GCMG, 13 November 2007)London Gazette Tuesday, 13 November 2007 *Dame of the Most Venerable Order of the Hospital of St. John of Jerusalem (DStJ, 16 October 2007)Court Circular detailing investiture as a Dame of the Most Venerable Order of the Hospital of St. John of Jerusalem ==References== Category:1944 births Category:Living people Category:Governors-General of Antigua and Barbuda
title: Louise Lake-Tack
